p: In December 2019, an outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) infection caused the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) that occurred in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China and spread worldwide in the next few weeks [ 1, 2]. Human-to-human transmission of COVID-19 was confirmed by droplets, contact and fomites [ 3, 4]. The researches have suggested that COVID-19 is more contagious than both severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) [ 1, 5â€“ 7].
